definition: from/through/via/to follow/to obey/to engage in (an activity)/never (in negative sentence)/(Taiwan pr. [zong4]) retainer/assistant/auxiliary/subordinate/related by common paternal grandfather or earlier ancestor

sentences.english: When a process forks, the child's capability sets are copied from the parent.
sentences.chinese: 在產生進程時，子進程從父進程複製能力集。

sentences.english: Grace unto you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
sentences.chinese: 願恩惠平安，從父神和主耶穌基督，歸與你們。

sentences.english: And so, my soul, thou art receiving a music lesson from thy Father.
sentences.chinese: 所以，我的己哪，你現在正在從父學習音樂功課。

definition: to adopt/to give for adoption (usually to a childless relative)
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
adoption (e.g. of a nephew as a son)/to inherit
lit. to order people by pointing the chin (idiom); to signal orders by facial gesture/arrogant and bossy
offspring a famous family (idiom); good breeding/blue blood
the cassock and alms bowl of a Buddhist master passed on to the favorite disciple (Buddhism)/legacy/mantle
running of armed forces/military management/to govern armed forces/to direct troops
to be orphaned of one's father
